newsitem.title: USA: Integrated sees Q2 well below estimates.
newsitem.headline: Integrated sees Q2 well below estimates.

text.p: Integrated Measurement Systems Inc warned Wednesday results for the second quarter will fall well below analysts' expectations.

The company said in a statement it expects net sales for the quarter, ended June 30, will be about 25 percent below analysts' consensus estimates of $14.5 million. It said earnings per share will be about 45 percent below analysts' consensus estimates of $0.26 for the second quarter.
In the comparable year-ago quarter the company reported earnings of $0.20 a share on revenues of $12.6 million.

The company said the weaker revenues were as a result of a number of second quarter orders being pushed back to the third quarter. The revenue shortfall was restricted to the company's Systems business.
Its Virtual Test Division is expected to yield strong results, and its Services business is anticipated to meet expectations.
